result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell David Vogt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked, 67 days credit
Concurrent with: current sentence

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such counseling as DOC deems appropriate.
After release from jail, defendant shall maintain full time employment, school or combination of both. If not employed, seek work with at least three applications per week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell David Vogt

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mitchell David Vogt appeared by phone, in custody of Waukesha County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Mitchell David Vogt. Attorney Zaleski advises defendant is accepting State's offer of 2 years probation, costs, DNA, counseling, and full time work or seek with 3 applications per week. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant waives personal appearance. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Zaleski heard. Defendant heard. Court orders probation 2 years, concurrent, costs, DNA, work full time or seek with 3 applications per week, counseling.

Defendant Mitchell David Vogt appeared by video from GCJ.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Mitchell David Vogt. Attorney Zaleski indicated this matter is not yet resolved and def. is still awaiting revocation in another county. State heard.  PTC/Status 6/14/22 at 10:30. JT week 6/28/22.
Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mitchell David Vogt appeared by video from GCJ, Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by zoom video for Mitchell David Vogt, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of PH. Court finds the def. freely, willingly & voluntarily waived his rights and binds the matter over for trial. Information is filed. Waives further reading and stands mute. Court will enter NG plea. Status: 4/27/22 at 1pm JT weeks 5/24 & 5/31.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Mitchell David Vogt appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charge, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests signature bond with condition to see a counselor. Defendant heard. Court orders a $1000 signature bond with the conditions to see a counselor and to contact SPD. Status date set.

Defendant shall see counselor as soon as possible. 
Defendant shall contact State Public Defender's Officer as soon as possible 608-401-2030.
Status conference on February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
